**Summary**
• Natron went from hyped $1.4B factory plans to liquidation in over a year—what the fuck even happened?
• They were supposed to make sodium-ion batteries, but I guess that didn’t work out so well.
• This whole debacle screams that the U.S. isn’t even close to being ready to produce its own batteries like a boss.

Impact — Natron’s collapse is a harsh wake-up call for the U.S. battery ambitions, exposing deep gaps in funding and infrastructure.
